channel.title: Writing on Personal Portfolio of Nate Rudolph
channel.description: Recent content in Writing on Personal Portfolio of Nate Rudolph

item.title: 2017 Reading List
item.description: I’ve typically kept New Year’s resolutions vague to free my late February conscious from the crushing weight of disappointment. But for whatever reason 2017 I decided to commit to reading at least one book a month. I think because it happened to coincide with a slow retreat from all forms of social media it has actually turned out to be pretty successful. “Call of the Wild” When trying to kickstart a new habit I think it’s helpful to make it easy on yourself.

item.title: The Inventor
item.description: Jack liked to make things. His bedroom floor was covered in broken alarm clocks, old remote controls, anything that was deemed “supplies” by Grandpa Flaherty. His latest project was a helmet that told the wearer the current weather. From each hole the in the rusty colander sprouted bunches of wires that lead to headphones attached at the handles. “Jack, get inside. It’s rai-” Grandpa Flaherty called from the porch.
